meanings.definition: Having a greater elasticity or bounce than something else.
meanings.sent1: The rubber ball was much springier than the clay ball.
meanings.sent2: The mattress felt springier after adding a new layer of foam.
meanings.sent3: The springier trampoline made the kids jump even higher with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as springier as a bouncing bunny.
meanings.sent5: The springier branches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Able to recover quickly from setbacks or difficulties.
meanings.sent1: Despite the fall, he was springier than ever and got back up immediately.
meanings.sent2: She showed a springier attitude after facing the challenge head-on.
meanings.sent3: His spirit remained springier even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as springier as a resilient spring.
meanings.sent5: The team's morale became springier after the unexpected win.

meanings.definition: Showing a lively or energetic quality.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's playful behavior was springier than the older dog's.
meanings.sent2: The dance performance was even more springier than the rehearsal.
meanings.sent3: Her springier personality always brought joy to those around her.
meanings.sent4: The festival atmosphere was as springier as a lively carnival.
meanings.sent5: The springier music had everyone tapping their feet in excitement.
